greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: From Wendt's determinant compute (-A048954(2*n)/3)^(1/3).
comment: It is known that 3 divides A048954(2*n). It is conjectured that the quotient is a perfect cube.
See A048954 for additional comments, references, links, and cross-references.
link: Gerard P. Michon, Factorization of Wendt's Determinant(see Remarks and Conjectures).
formula: a(n) = 0 if and only if n is divisible by 3.
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_, Aug 17 2012
